content: Argo-Q created a Q-timing extension to represent duration allowed for Q or Q.item. I think this extension should be a core extension. A lot of tests have time limits either implicit or explicit. And allows for timing out a form when doing adaptive Q in a 'stateless' model. ( duration based on most recent QA.authored time ).
Is that in the current IG draft?
Fine with it being submitted as a core extension

latest Argo-Q Draft is here just stubbed in Adaptive stuff but timing in extensions.
https://argonautproject.github.io/questionnaire/index.html

we talked about when the clock start ticking on timing and thought is was defined by the implementation. Any thoughts? for different use cases would be different triggers - for a timed test the client may decide when it starts, for adaptive Q the server may decide when it send a response?
